profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Nottingham, Chester County, Pa., September 8, 1769; attended the public schools; engaged in agricultural pursuits; studied law; was admitted to the bar and practiced; judge of York County from July 1, 1800, to March 29, 1813; elected as a Republican to the Thirteenth and Fourteenth Congresses (March 4, 1813-March 3, 1817); died at Peach Bottom, York County, Pa., January 31, 1818; interment in Slate Ridge Burying Ground.

researchRecord.name: 1783-1814, 1 folder.
researchRecord.description: A copybook and account books of Hugh Glasgow, who was a merchant of Peach Bottom, Pennsylvania.

recordLocation.name: York County Heritage Trust/Historical Society of York County
